title: Privacy dashboard with automatic anti-tracking controls (VPN-like experience)

requirements.text: Build a VPN-like Privacy Dashboard experience (without implementing an actual VPN) that helps users automatically stop tracking by detecting common web/app trackers and blocking them within the app’s simulated traffic model.

quotes: Create a VPN that has a privacy feature that automatically stops tracking

acceptanceCriteria: The UI clearly states it is a privacy/anti-tracking dashboard and not a real VPN tunnel.
A primary toggle labeled in English (e.g., “Auto-stop tracking”) enables/disables anti-tracking.
The main screen shows current protection status (On/Off) and a short explanation of what happens when enabled.

requirements.text: Implement tracker detection for user-provided destinations: allow the user to input a URL/domain (and optionally paste a list), scan it against a built-in tracker blocklist, and show which tracker domains would be blocked when “Auto-stop tracking” is enabled.

quotes: privacy feature that automatically stops tracking

acceptanceCriteria: User can enter a URL/domain and trigger a scan.
Results display: (a) detected tracker matches, (b) non-tracker domains, and (c) a summary count.
When Auto-stop tracking is ON, matched trackers are labeled “Blocked”; when OFF, labeled “Allowed.”

requirements.text: Create a Motoko backend API to manage anti-tracking settings and blocklists per user principal, including: get/set Auto-stop tracking toggle; get blocklist; add/remove custom blocked domains; reset to defaults.
acceptanceCriteria: Backend exposes methods to read and update the user’s anti-tracking enabled state.
Backend persists user custom blocked domains keyed by caller principal.
Backend provides a default blocklist (hardcoded in canister) and merges it with user custom entries when returning the effective list.
Anonymous/unauthenticated usage is handled gracefully (e.g., defaults are used until the user signs in), without crashes.

requirements.text: Connect frontend to backend with React Query for loading/saving privacy settings and custom block entries, including optimistic UI updates and clear error states.

quotes: privacy feature that automatically stops tracking

acceptanceCriteria: Toggling Auto-stop tracking updates the UI immediately and persists to backend.
Adding/removing a custom blocked domain updates the list and persists to backend.
Network/loading states are visible (skeleton/spinner and disabled buttons where appropriate).
Errors are shown in English with a retry action.

requirements.text: Add a “Protection Log” view that records recent scans/actions in the UI (client-side), including timestamp, input domain/URL, number of trackers detected, and number blocked based on current settings.
acceptanceCriteria: After each scan, a new log entry appears at the top of the log list.
Log entries include time, target, detected count, and blocked count.
User can clear the protection log from the UI.

requirements.text: Apply a coherent, distinctive visual theme for a privacy/security product (avoid blue/purple): define consistent colors, typography, spacing, and component styling across the Privacy Dashboard, including light/dark-friendly contrast.

quotes: Create a VPN that has a privacy feature that automatically stops tracking

acceptanceCriteria: Theme is consistent across all new screens/components.
Color palette avoids blue and purple as primary accents.
The UI has clear hierarchy and accessible contrast for key states (Protected/Unprotected, Blocked/Allowed).

requirements.text: Add and render generated static image assets (logo and hero) from frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the dashboard header/empty-state areas.

quotes: Create a VPN that has a privacy feature that automatically stops tracking

acceptanceCriteria: Images exist under frontend/public/assets/generated with the specified filenames.
Frontend references these images as static assets (no backend image routing).
Logo and hero are visible in the UI without layout shifts or broken links.

constraints: Do not implement or claim to implement a real VPN tunnel, packet routing, device-wide traffic interception, or OS-level tracking prevention; provide an in-app anti-tracking dashboard and simulated blocking based on user input.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in the main actor file).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutablePaths; compose those components instead.
All user-facing text must be in English.
nonGoals: Browser extension functionality (e.g., intercepting real browsing requests).
DNS-level blocking, firewall rules, or system proxy configuration.
Third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity if authentication is used).
Real-time streaming logs or WebSocket-based updates.

required: Minimal privacy shield logo with a stop-tracking motif, flat vector style, dark background compatible (vpn-shield-logo.dim_512x512.png)
Wide hero illustration showing abstract network nodes with blocked tracker dots, muted green/charcoal palette, flat/modern style (privacy-hero.dim_1200x600.png)
